title: Processes - Second Derivative of Parametric Eqs

content.question: If <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, then <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="2 t times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 t times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis, and denominator 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 t times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis, and denominator 25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 t times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis, and denominator 25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
